DOC.brief_summary: This 6-week , double-blind , randomize , placebo-controlled , multicenter , parallel group Phase 3 study NAFT-600 apply day 2 week compare vehicle ( placebo ) treatment tinea pedis .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Efficacy Safety NAFT-600 Subjects With Tinea Pedis
DOC.detailed_description: This study open male non-pregnant female , 12 year age , clinical sign symptom tinea pedis consist least moderate erythema , moderate scaling , mild pruritus , positive screening KOH , positive culture.Subjects evaluate Day 1 ( baseline ) , Week 2 , Week 4 , Week 6 ( follow-up ) . Adverse event , concomitant medication , study drug compliance review visit . Efficacy assessment include KOH culture evaluation , clinical signs/symptoms ( erythema , scaling , pruritus ) , Investigator 's Global Assessment .

For minor ( less 18 year ) , parent/legal guardian must complete informed consent process AND subject must complete assent process sign appropriate form ( age appropriate ) . Presence interdigital interdigital moccasin type tinea pedis one foot characterize clinical evidence tinea infection ( least moderate erythema , moderate scaling mild pruritus ) base sign symptom affect area ( ) . Subjects lifethreatening condition ( ex . autoimmune deficiency syndrome , cancer , unstable angina myocardial infarction ) within last 6 month . Subjects abnormal finding physical laboratory consider investigator clinically important indicative condition might complicate interpretation study result . Subjects know hypersensitivity study drug component . Subjects recent history currently know abuse alcohol drug . Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus . Hemodialysis chronic ambulatory peritoneal dialysis therapy . Current diagnosis immunocompromising condition . Foot psoriasis , corn and/or callus involve web space , atopic contact dermatitis . Severe dermatophytoses , onychomycosis ( evaluated foot ) , mucocutaneous candidiasis bacterial skin infection . Extremely severe tinea pedis ( incapacitate ) .
